009package imagingbook.common.geometry.ellipse;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012import static java.lang.Math.PI;
013import static java.lang.Math.cos;
014import static java.lang.Math.sin;
015import static java.lang.Math.sqrt;
016
017import java.awt.Shape;
018import java.awt.geom.AffineTransform;
019import java.awt.geom.Ellipse2D;
020import java.awt.geom.Path2D;
021import java.util.Locale;
022
023import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Curve2d;
024import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
025import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.ShapeProvider;
026import imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic;
027import imagingbook.common.math.PrintPrecision;
028
029/**
030 * Represents an ellipse shape with arbitrary orientation.
031 * 
032 * @author WB
033 *
034 */
035public class GeometricEllipse implements Ellipse, ShapeProvider, Curve2d {
036        
037        public final double ra, rb, xc, yc, theta;      // TODO: make private!
038        private final OrthogonalEllipseProjector projector;
039        
040        public GeometricEllipse(double ra, double rb, double xc, double yc, double theta) {
041                this.xc = xc;
042                this.yc = yc;
043                if (ra >= rb) { // make sure ra is always the longer axis!
044                        this.ra = ra;
045                        this.rb = rb;
046                        this.theta = Arithmetic.mod(theta, PI); // theta = 0,...,pi always
047                }
048                else {
049                        this.ra = rb; // swap ra/rb
050                        this.rb = ra;
051                        this.theta = Arithmetic.mod(theta + PI/2, PI);  // theta = 0,...,pi always
052                }
053                this.projector = new OrthogonalEllipseProjector(this);
054                
055                if (this.ra < this.rb) {
056                        throw new RuntimeException(this.toString());
057                }
058        }
059        
060        public GeometricEllipse(double ra, double rb, double xc, double yc) {
061                this(ra, rb, xc, yc, 0.0);
062        }
063        
064        // TODO: reorder parameters
065        public GeometricEllipse(double[] p) {
066                this(p[0], p[1], p[2], p[3], p[4]);
067        }
068        
069        public GeometricEllipse(AlgebraicEllipse ae) {
070                this(makeGeometricEllipseParameters(ae));
071        }
072        
073        public GeometricEllipse scale(double scaleFactor) {
074                return new GeometricEllipse(ra * scaleFactor, rb * scaleFactor, xc, yc, theta);
075        }
076        
077//      public static GeometricEllipse from(double[] p) {
078//              return new GeometricEllipse(p);
079//      }
080        
081        private static double[] makeGeometricEllipseParameters(AlgebraicEllipse ae) {
082                final double A = ae.A;
083                final double B = ae.B;
084                final double C = ae.C;
085                final double D = ae.D;
086                final double E = ae.E;
087                final double F = ae.F;
088                
089                final double bac = sqr(B) - 4*A*C;
090                
091                if (bac >= 0) {
092                        throw new IllegalArgumentException("B^2 - 4AC must be negative for an ellipse");
093                }
094
095                final double q = sqrt(sqr(A-C) + sqr(B));
096                final double s = 2*(A*sqr(E) + C*sqr(D) + F*sqr(B) - B*D*E - 4*A*C*F);
097                
098                double xc = (2*C*D - B*E) / bac;
099                double yc = (2*A*E - B*D) / bac;
100                double ra = sqrt(s / (bac*(- A - C + q)));
101                double rb = sqrt(s / (bac*(- A - C - q)));
102                double theta = 0.5 * Math.atan2(-B, C - A);     // theta = -pi/2,...,+pi/2
103                
104                return (ra >= rb) ? // make sure ra >= rb (ra is the major axis)
105                        new double[] {ra, rb, xc, yc, theta} :
106                        new double[] {rb, ra, xc, yc, theta + PI/2} ;
107        }
108        
109        // see Eq. 19-23 at http://mathworld.wolfram.com/Ellipse.html
110        @Deprecated
111        public static GeometricEllipse from(AlgebraicEllipse ae) {
112                return new GeometricEllipse(ae);
113//              final double A = ae.A;
114//              final double B = ae.B;
115//              final double C = ae.C;
116//              final double D = ae.D;
117//              final double E = ae.E;
118//              final double F = ae.F;
119//              
120//              final double p = sqr(B) - 4*A*C;
121//              
122//              if (p >= 0) {
123//                      throw new IllegalArgumentException("B^2 - 4AC must be negative for an ellipse");
124//              }
125//
126//              final double q = sqrt(sqr(A-C) + sqr(B));
127//              final double s = 2*(A*sqr(E) + C*sqr(D) + F*sqr(B) - B*D*E - 4*A*C*F);
128//              
129//              double xc = (2*C*D - B*E) / p;
130//              double yc = (2*A*E - B*D) / p;
131//              double ra = sqrt(s / (p*(- A - C + q)));
132//              double rb = sqrt(s / (p*(- A - C - q)));
133//              double theta = 0.5 * Math.atan2(-B, C - A);     // theta = -pi/2,...,+pi/2
134//              
135//              return (ra >= rb) ? // make sure ra >= rb (ra is the major axis)
136//                      new GeometricEllipse(xc, yc, ra, rb, theta) :
137//                      new GeometricEllipse(xc, yc, rb, ra, theta + PI/2) ;
138        }
139        
140        // ---------------------------------------
141        
142        @Override
143        public double[] getParameters() {
144                return new double[] {ra, rb, xc, yc, theta};
145        }
146        
147        public Pnt2d getCenter() {
148                return Pnt2d.from(xc, yc);
149        }
150        
151        public double getArea() {
152                return this.ra * this.rb * Math.PI;
153        }
154        
155        public double getAlgebraicDistance(Pnt2d p) {
156                return AlgebraicEllipse.from(this).getAlgebraicDistance(p);
157        }
158        
159        /**
160         * Returns the ellipse point closest to the specified point.
161         * To perform this calculation for multiple points on the
162         * same ellipse use {@link OrthogonalEllipseProjector}.
163         * 
164         * @see OrthogonalEllipseProjector
165         * @param pnt some 2D point
166         * @return the closest ("contact") point on the ellipse
167         */
168        public Pnt2d getClosestPoint(Pnt2d pnt) {
169                return projector.project(pnt);
170        }
171        
172        public double[] getClosestPoint(double[] pnt) {
173                return projector.project(pnt);
174        }
175        
176        public GeometricEllipse disturb(double dra, double drb, double dxc, double dyc, double dtheta) {
177                return new GeometricEllipse(ra + dra, rb + drb, xc + dxc, yc + dyc, theta + dtheta);
178        }
179                
180        // ---------------------------------------------------------------------------------
181
182    /**
183         * Returns the mean squared error between this ellipse 
184         * and a set of 2D points.
185         *
186         * @param points a set of sample points (usually the points used for fitting)
187         * @return the mean squared error
188         */
189        public double getMeanSquareError(Pnt2d[] points) {
190                double sum2 = 0;
191                for (Pnt2d p : points) {
192                        sum2 = sum2 + p.distanceSq(getClosestPoint(p));
193                }
194                return sum2 / points.length;
195        }
196        
197        /**
198         * Returns the closest (geometric) distance of the specified point to this ellipse.
199         * @param p some 2D point
200         * @return the distance to the closest point on the ellipse
201         */
202        @Override
203        public double getDistance(Pnt2d p) {
204                return p.distance(getClosestPoint(p));
205        }
206        
207        // ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
208        
209        @Override
210        public Shape getShape(double scale) {
211                return this.getOuterShape();
212        }
213        
214        @Override
215        public Shape[] getShapes(double scale) {
216                return new Shape[] {
217                                getOuterShape(),
218                                getCenterShape(scale),
219                                //getAxisShape()
220                };
221        }
222        
223        @Deprecated     // TODO: should be private
224        public Shape getOuterShape() {
225                Ellipse2D oval = new Ellipse2D.Double(-ra, -rb, 2 * ra, 2 * rb);
226                AffineTransform trans = new AffineTransform();
227                trans.translate(xc, yc);
228                trans.rotate(theta);
229                return trans.createTransformedShape(oval);
230        }
231        
232        @Deprecated     // TODO: should be private
233        public Shape getCenterShape(double radius) {
234                double dxa = 2 * radius * cos(theta);   // major axis is drawn longer
235                double dya = 2 * radius * sin(theta);
236                double dxb = 1 * radius * cos(theta + PI/2);
237                double dyb = 1 * radius * sin(theta + PI/2);
238                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
239                path.moveTo(xc - dxa, yc - dya);
240                path.lineTo(xc + dxa, yc + dya);
241                path.moveTo(xc - dxb, yc - dyb);
242                path.lineTo(xc + dxb, yc + dyb);
243//              path.moveTo(xc - radius, yc);
244//              path.lineTo(xc + radius, yc);
245//              path.moveTo(xc, yc - radius);
246//              path.lineTo(xc, yc + radius);
247                return path;
248        }
249        
250        @Deprecated     // TODO: should be private
251        public Shape getAxisShape() {
252                double dxa = ra * cos(theta);
253                double dya = ra * sin(theta);
254                double dxb = rb * cos(theta + PI/2);
255                double dyb = rb * sin(theta + PI/2);
256                Path2D path = new Path2D.Double();
257                path.moveTo(xc - dxa, yc - dya);
258                path.lineTo(xc + dxa, yc + dya);
259                path.moveTo(xc - dxb, yc - dyb);
260                path.lineTo(xc + dxb, yc + dyb);
261                return path;
262        }
263        
264        @Deprecated
265        public Pnt2d getLeftAxisPoint() {
266                return Pnt2d.from(xc - ra * cos(theta), yc - ra * sin(theta));
267        }
268        
269        // -------------------------------
270        
271        @Override
272        public String toString() {
273                return String.format(Locale.US, "%s [ra=%.8f, rb=%.8f, xc=%.8f, yc=%.8f, theta=%.8f]", 
274                                this.getClass().getSimpleName(), ra, rb, xc, yc, theta);
275        }
276        
277        // ----------------------------------------------------------
278        
279        public static void main(String[] args) {
280                PrintPrecision.set(12);
281                
282//              Ellipse e1 = new Ellipse( 13, 77, 66, 33, Math.PI/2+9.5);
283//              System.out.println("e1 = " + e1.toString());
284//              AlgebraicEllipse a1 = AlgebraicEllipse.from(e1);
285//              System.out.println("a1 = " + a1.toString());
286//              
287//              Ellipse e2 = Ellipse.from(a1);
288//              System.out.println("e2 = " + e2.toString());
289//              AlgebraicEllipse a2 = AlgebraicEllipse.from(e2);
290//              System.out.println("a2 = " + a2.toString());
291                
292                GeometricEllipse ell = new GeometricEllipse(6, 5, 0, 0, 0);
293                
294                Pnt2d x = Pnt2d.from(0, -0.000000001);
295                System.out.println("x  = " + x);
296                
297                Pnt2d xp = ell.getClosestPoint(x);
298                System.out.println("xp = " + xp);
299                
300                // ---------------------------------------------
301                
302//              Ellipse eg = new Ellipse(120, 50, 200, 200, 0.4);
303//              Ellipse eg = new Ellipse(120, 50, 200, 200, 0.0);
304                GeometricEllipse eg1 = new GeometricEllipse(120, 50, 200, 200, Math.PI/2);
305                System.out.println("eg1 = " + eg1.toString());
306                System.out.println("eg = " + eg1.toString());
307                AlgebraicEllipse ea = AlgebraicEllipse.from(eg1);
308                System.out.println("ea = " + ea.toString());
309                GeometricEllipse eg2 = GeometricEllipse.from(ea);
310                System.out.println("eg2 = " + eg2.toString());
311                
312        }
313
